As spot prices collapse, miners quickly become distressed again, burdened by ambitious projections, debt, and stale equipment (often paid a premium).

These miners can’t afford to mine at a loss for long. They’re flushed out of the market.

This is where we’re at in the cycle.

1067076381346025474.text:
Bitcoin miners operate in cycles.

1. At the bottom, BITMAIN increases market share, squeezes out distressed miners.

2. New entrants emerge with higher spot prices, healthy margins.

3. At the peak, everyone eats. Secondary markets soar, miners pay big premiums for equipment.
